website_summaries.verdict: For its $100 price tag, the Under Armour Charged Controller delivers great value. What you get is a fully-knitted upper and a full-length Micro G midsole with a Charged foam crash pad that offers a well-balanced ride. It is a versatile shoe that will provide you with what you need when you need it.If it were not for its disappointing traction and fit, these UA basketball sneakers would have been a top-tier performer. All in all, the Charged Controller is a steal for its price; just be prepared to wipe a whole lot if you regularly play on dusty courts.
pros: The Charged Controller is one of the most comfortable Under Armour shoes, many reviewers remark
Several wearers commend the shoe’s beautiful design
They are saying that it looks sharp and is perfect to wear on casual Fridays
The fit is nearly perfect, almost all experts declare
Majority of the buyers are very satisfied with the Under Armour Charged Controller
They are impressed with its quality and overall performance
The shoe does a good job at delivering both lockdown and support, a good number of users notice
Even if the shoe is a low-top model (like the Curry 6), they still feel stable and experience no heel slippage
A few reviewers notice that these Under Armour basketball shoes are well built and are pretty durable
They say it’s okay to use on outdoor courts
Many players observe that the traction works fairly well on clean courts
A lot of testers appreciate the shoe’s soft and flexible upper
They note that it is light, breathable, and conforms to the shape of your foot
Most testers are happy with the cushioning setup
They observe that the cushioning is soft when standing and stiffens up during play, providing the right balance between impact protection and responsiveness
cons: Nearly all testers express their disappointment with the Charged Controller’s inconsistent traction
On dusty courts, wiping is necessary since the pattern grabs dust easily
Some reviewers note that the toe box is pretty roomy
The Under Armour Charged Controller runs slightly narrow, a handful of wearers report
A couple of testers comment that the upper feels stiff and needs some break-in time
Players also gripe about the same experience in the UA HOVR Havoc
During hard stops, a few players complain about their toes hitting the tip of the shoe

customer_reviews.title: I've bought countless indoor court shoes and this one has the best grip. I actually use these for indoor volleyball
customer_reviews.text: I've been a long-time Adidas guy, but this particular shoe convinced me that Under Armour is a major player. I've bought countless indoor court shoes and this one has the best grip. I actually use these for indoor volleyball. I'm amazed how grippy it is even with dusty courts. I was so impressed that I immediately bought a second pair. Great shoes, not to high, not too low. I definitely feel confident moving around the court with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bentacular

customer_reviews.title: I love most of the products
customer_reviews.text: I'm an UA supporter. I love most of the products. I like the shoes ecstatically its a 5 star Pro: shoes look stunning, and lightweight, comfy at walking Cons: fit a bit tight in the sole, an orthopaedic plantar doesn't fit inside. Its a big con to me or who has wide sole ....but for average feet are good shoes
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Fascio

customer_reviews.title: Good materials, slightly large
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are well-assembled and fairly comfortable. The materials are of good quality, and the upper is more durable than I expected given that it's a lighter polyester-like material. The cushion is fairly comfortable. I can definitely feel the UA charged in the heel. It's pretty bouncy, but when standing in place it gets a little stiff. When you're in motion it's much better. I've also found that wearing these with two pairs of socks provides the best fit, otherwise I don't feel as secure and it affects the level of overall comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and nice looking shoe for the price. I should’ve gone a half size down but I have to do that for 50% of the shoes I buy anyway
customer_reviews.author: Frieder Schnell

customer_reviews.title: looked pretty good, my grandson loved them
customer_reviews.text: Received them today , looked pretty good , my grandson loved them! I have purchased under armor for him before the only brand that he doesn't destroy quickly! Received them in 2 days love my Amozon!!

customer_reviews.title: He loves the look of them and I loved the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 15 year old son. He loves the look of them and I loved the price.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoe at a great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality shoe for playing basketball. The traction and support is great while staying lightweight.

customer_reviews.title: Under Armour always is my favorite sports choice
customer_reviews.text: Under Armour always is my favorite sports choice. This item is as what I expect when I bought on line; good quality with excellent price. I will be more.

customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these shoes. Good price. Fits well. Like the style and colors. Intent to use to play tennis especially because of the black toe. May consider ordering another pair soon.

customer_reviews.title: Go half size down
customer_reviews.text: Sooo go a half size down it is the best fit but If you’re a wide footer you might have to stay true to size like I’m usually a 9.5 but I got this shoe in size 9 because it runs long and wide

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers. Was looking for a new pair of shoes for the gym and to play some basketball. These feel great on the court. Size is true.

customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot so the size fit perfectly

customer_reviews.text: Lasted a year great fit, re ordering these shoes again

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Charged Controller Basketball Shoe
product_meta.description: Seamless, one-piece knit upper built with Threadborne technology for flex & stability. Lightweight, breathable construction delivers unrivaled ventilation. Articulated bootie fit with zonal lycra for a sock-like compression fit. Robust webbing bands ensure a lockdown fit throughout the foot. Low profile, external TPU heel counter for increased stability. Die-cut, Anti-odor technology applied to molded Ortholite sockliner to prevent the growth of odor-causing microbes molds to the shape of the foot . Full-length Micro G midsole carriage delivers unmatched lightweight responsiveness . Charged Cushioning crash pad placed under the heel to absorb impact & convert it into a responsive burst of energy. Injection TPU midsole shank offers dynamic motion control. Weight: 13 oz.
feature_bullets: Seamless, one piece knit upper built with Threadborne technology for flex & stability
Lightweight, breathable construction delivers unrivaled ventilation
Articulated bootie fit with zonal lycra for a sock like compression fit
Robust webbing bands ensure a lockdown fit throughout the foot
Low profile, external TPU heel counter for increased stability
